title: What next for Tony Bellew? Five possible fights after his shock win over David Haye
text:
Sport What next for Tony Bellew? Five possible fights after his shock win over David Haye Bellew pulled off one of the great shocks in British boxing history and has a whole host of options ahead Share By Jack Rathborn Martin Domin 00:34, 5 MAR 2017 Tony Bellew celebrates defeating David Haye (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
Tony Bellew delivered one of the greatest shocks in British boxing history to defeat David Haye . 
The Bomber came on strong after the Hayemaker injured himself in the sixth round and knocked his opponent through the ropes in the 11th round before trainer Shane McGuigan chucked the towel in. 
The rematch is one option, but there is plenty more besides. Let's take a look at what's next for, in the man's own words, 'the champion of misfits.' Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Mirror boxing correspondent David Anderson give his ringside verdict on Haye vs Bellew Share this video Ant and Dec lead list of celebrities to attend David Haye vs Tony Bellew David Haye 
"So much respect for David as a fighter," Bellew remarked after the fight. "We can do it again!" 
Whether Bellew would want to give the Hayemaker a chance to exact revenge, this time fully fit - potentially - is unclear. 
But it sells, undoubtedly, and probably a damn sight better than any other potential opponent. If Bellew is all about securing his family future, the rematch is the way to go. 
And given the unfortunate nature of Haye's demise in this fight, plus his good grace afterwards, it would be refreshing to see it happen for a second time. Tony Bellew shakes hands with David Haye after his 11th round TKO (Photo: Getty) Haye launches a power shot vs Bellew (Photo: REUTERS) Deontay Wilder 
The American is potentially as powerful as David Haye, yet that doesn't appear to have scared off Bellew. 
"I want Deontay Wilder, you want to sit down with the big man? I have one more night left," Bellew remarked after the fight. 
Wilder appears to be hiding some glass on his chin and looked technically poor in his last outing, so this is understandably a great option for Bellew: high reward but potentially an easier route to victory than against a recovered Haye. Deontay Wilder fights Chris Arreola (Photo: Marvin Gentry/USA TODAY Sports/Reuters) Mairis Briedis/Marco Huck 
If Bellew wants to keep hold of his cruiserweight world title, he will have to defend it against either Briedis or Huck who meet on April 1. 
Latvian Briedis boxed on Bellewâ€™s undercard last year and has stopped 18 of his 21 opponents. Huck, meanwhile, ruled the 200lb division for six years before losing to Krzysztof Glowacki in 2015. 
Subsequent victories over Ola Afolabi and Dmytro Kucher have put him back in world title contention. Mairis Briedis boxed on Bellew's undercard last year (Photo: PA Wire) Oleksandr Usyk 
He may have only 11 professional fights to his name but he looks assured of a place on the pound-for-pound rankings before too long. 
The Ukrainian holds the WBO world title and is an option for Bellew in the unlikely event he gave up his own belt. 
Usyk must first overcome Michael Hunter next month but that looks a mere formality for the 30-year-old. Oleksandr Usyk holds the WBO title (Photo: Getty Images North America) Read More Twitter reacts to Tony Bellew's shock win over David Haye: 'Bomber couldn't knock him out on one leg!' Murat Gassiev 
It's unlikely that the WBC would allow Bellew another exemption but if Briedis or Huck need a lengthy time out, they might allow a unification clash in the meantime. 
Gassiev has won all 24 of his bouts on his way to picking up the IBF strap, knocking out 17. The Russian could probably be tempted over to the UK to give Bellew another night in front of his own fans. (Photo: Anadolu) Retirement? 
Bellew admitted he doesn't want to do this forever after victory over Haye. But the scouser did claim he has 'one fight left in me' - at least, presumably. 
The cash will probably prove too much to resist, but Bellew could never go out on a greater high than this - but then you would have said the same after his victory at Goodison Park against Ilunga Makabu. poll loading Will Tony Bellew give David Haye a rematch? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
